intro: Sphaeralcea variabilis, commonly known as the variable globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough, hairy texture. Sphaeralcea variabilis is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
